snippet: In sections of the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens, a majority of tenants pay more than 50 percent of their income for rent. Perhaps the new mayor will tackle this desperate mathematics.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column holds that Democratic mayoral contender Bill de Blasio appears poised to win in a rout, in no small part because he is willing to talk of a city deeply divided between rich and poor; says perhaps new mayor will tackle desperate mathematics of New York City renters forced to pay more than 50 percent of their income to have a home.
lead_paragraph: In sections of the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens, a majority of tenants pay more than 50 percent of their income for rent. Perhaps the new mayor will tackle this desperate mathematics.

headline.main: In Housing Court, Different View of New York City’s Mayoral Race
headline.print_headline: Housing Court: Different View Of 2013 Race
